entry.title: Game: N+ (X360, 2008) (10)
entry.content: Based on my last experience with the game, I think I'm basically done with the game. I'm pretty conflicted about it, because it is good on many levels, but a lot of it is so broken. The structure of the game play---5 levels at a time, no saving, is probably the worst thing about it for me, because I like to play in such small chunks. But also, the mechanics just aren't tight enough for me. I know that the physics/momentum is a conscious design decision, but I don't think it works. Whereas in Super Meat Boy, I can do many sequences exactly the same every time, I find N+ to be very variable in how I perform, even though I feel like I'm doing the same thing, because the momentum isn't quite right. This leads to great frustration and lack of fun. I can't remember if the DS game was like this and I just hadn't noticed because I hadn't play SMB yet.

entry.title: Game: N+ (X360, 2008) (9)
entry.content: Played Episode 41 Level 4 for almost an hour. Sometimes when I play this game, I think to myself, "Wow, I hate this game's controls so much." It is so frustrating that they never seem to work right. Super Meat Boy has almost ruined every other platformer for me. In fact, I'm so mad at the game right now, I am demoting it from every two days to once a week.

entry.title: Game: N+ (X360, 2008) (6)
entry.content: Some of the levels in the game are just too absurd. For example, Episode 39, level 1 has you do the same challenge over and over again. The game just isn't very streamlined in the teaching you. You feel like you know how to do something but are forced to do it again, even though you aren't really dying and restarting. Obviously I'll still be it, but it's very annoying. The worst thing about the game is having to do 5 at a time.
